alert.note: Alert for Hemphill; Lipscomb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:32PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lipscomb and northeastern Hemphill Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 231 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 6 miles northwest of Glazier, or 10 miles south of Lipscomb, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lipscomb and Glazier. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
